pr_title: KAFKA-8955: Add an AbstractResponse#errorCounts(Stream) and tidy

timeline.message:
KAFKA-8955: Add an AbstractResponse#errorCounts(Stream) and tidy

* Add AbstractResponse#errorCounts(Stream) to avoid having to call
  AbstractResponse#errorCounts(Collection) with a computed collection.

* Use updateErrorMap() consistently.

* Replace a couple of forEach() with for statements for consistency.

* Use singleton errorMap() consistently.

timeline.bodyText: It seems like the previous approach is actually more concise and as clear?
timeline.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: Fair enough, I reverted those two changes. Would you like me to also change the places where for statements were already being used?
replies.author: tombentley

replies.bodyText: If you would like to clean that up, sure.
replies.author: ijuma

timeline.bodyText: it seems this implementation can be replaced by #errorCounts(Stream<Errors>)
timeline.author: chia7712

replies.bodyText:
@chia7712 you're right, but the only two remaining callers of this method are for RPCs which haven't been converted to the message generator. There's little benefit to changing them when there are already PRs for converting those RPCs, and I'm planning to remove this method entirely when those PRs have been merged. I guess I could mark this method as @Deprecated.
Relatedly there's only a single caller of the apiErrorCounts(Map<?, ApiError> errors) method which is also for an not-yet-converted RPC with a PR. If this gets merged first I'll be able to remove apiErrorCounts(Map<?, ApiError> errors) in that PR.
replies.author: tombentley

timeline.bodyText:
Could we leverage the new method errorCounts(Stream<Errors>)? For example:
return errorCounts(data.results().stream().map(result -> Errors.forCode(result.errorCode())));
timeline.author: chia7712

replies.bodyText:
@chia7712 what I've tried to do in this PR so far is:

Change for stmt  + updateErrorCounts to use forEach consistently
Change calls to errorCounts(Collection) to errorCounts(Stream)

I've not tried to change all code to use either forEach or errorCounts(Stream). Obviously we could do that, but @ijuma seems happy enough with continuing to have these two ways to do it.
replies.author: tombentley

timeline.bodyText: @tombentley Have we done any testing to verify that this way of doing things is no slower than the old way?
timeline.author: ijuma

replies.author: tombentley

replies.bodyText: Thanks! I think the way you have it now is both fast and concise, not worth changing it to use forEach given how this is normally used.
replies.author: ijuma

timeline.bodyText: We can probably update updateErrorsCounts to use getOrDefault (I can't comment on the relevant line directly).
timeline.author: ijuma
ijuma
ijuma
ijuma

timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason why we are not doing the map within the flatMap?
timeline.author: ijuma

timeline.bodyText: Any reason why we don't do the map inside the flatMap?
timeline.author: ijuma
